item.description:
Let's do a sharp left turn on our White Tour de France and swing through the Alsace region before heading south.

Through out history the Alsace region has sometimes been part of France and sometimes it's been part of Germany, but Alsace has stuck to its winemaking traditions and is today renown for its Gewurztraminers, Rieslings, pinot gris, muscat, and pinot blanc. Most of the wine they produce is dry, but perhaps we can find an example of their late harvest styles.

As always, looking for volunteers to purchase wine (you will be reimbursed) and to bring appetizers to share. The cost of the wines will be spread amongst those who attend.

group.name: The MetroWest White Wine Meetup Group

item.name: July Meeting--Alsace
